class.name: CommandLineOption
class.description: This class is used to describe an option on the command line. It allows different ways of defining the same option with multiple aliases possible. It is also used to describe how the option is used - it may be a flag (e.g. [code]-v[/code]) or take a value (e.g. [code]-o file[/code]).

method.name: remove_checker
method.description: Removes the checker added by [method set_checker].

method.name: set_checker

members.member: Set of values that allowed by the option. If a different value is passed, the parsing will fail. Empty if any value is allowed.
The number of arguments required for the option. A value less than 0 means all remaining values up to the next option or the end of the argument list.
Name for the option arguments that will be displayed in help message. For example: [code]--input <filename>[/code], where [code]<filename>[/code] is arg_text.
Option category, options sharing the same category are grouped together in the help message.
Set of values that will be used by default if no value specified.
Option description that will be displayed in help.
If [code]true[/code], the option will be displayed in help.
If [code]true[/code], option can be specified multiply times. Number of times can be obtained using [method CommandLineParser.get_occurence_count].
Returns the names set for this option.
If [code]true[/code], option can be specified without option name. In this case, the first unparsed option marked as [member positional] will be selected.
If [code]true[/code], [method CommandLineParser.validate] will return an error if the option was not specified in the argument list.

signal.name: validated
signal.description: Emitted when after calling [method CommandLineParser.validate] if it returns [constant OK] and this option was specified in the argument list. [code]values[/code] contains all values that was passed to the option.
